5 Things about Posture Braces You Must Know

1. Know What Good Posture Is

Posture refers to the way human beings maintain their body to sit, stand and lie in accordance with gravity force and keep an aligned position by using various body muscles . http://shop.intelliskin.net

Good posture has several requirements: Normal muscle mobility and strength, flexibility of joints, good strength in the muscle groups responsible for good posture, such as the spinous muscles in the neck and back, and above all, an awareness of one's own posture so that deviations from the normal posture can be recognized.

Proper posture not only helps a person to maintain his spinal alignment at optimal level but also lowers the chances of common muscles issues often expected in bad posture case. http://shop.intelliskin.net

{2. Contributing Factors to Poor Posture| 2. Factors Contributing to Bad Posture | 2. Factors Causing Poor Posture

The factors causing the poor posture can be equal in number to the factors causing the good posture. Examples of these factors can include obesity--where weakened abdominal muscles increase strain on the paraspinous muscles in the mid and lower back--pregnancy, high-heel shoes, diminished overall flexibility, and poor work environments and habits. http://www.intelliskin.net

3. Understanding the function of posture braces?

Most of the over-the-counter, non-prescriptive braces exert their influence on the shoulders and upper back, gently pulling the shoulders back, thus pulling the upper thoracic area into slight extension. But in most cases such braces usually strap around the upper should area and cover the mid back region in a cris-cross manner.

Some braces provide strong support to abdominal parts in the form of wide covering around the area to create pressure over these organs in a nice gentle manner. Such type of supports prove helpful at later pregnancy stage to maintain the hyper extension over lumber spinal region.

4. Braces Do Not Prove the Best Possible Alternative for Body Mechanics

No doubt bracing can be useful in relieving the bad posture strain problems but it can’t be reliable as the best alternative for balanced body posture. Getting training for proper bending, lifting and stooping can be useful in reducing the chances of normal injuries along with training the muscles to keep the proper posture while doing daily life activities. http://shop.intelliskin.net/posture-exercises-for-better-posture.html

Many people needs specific training to understand ergonomics and body mechanism. Such incentives can help reducing the chances of work related injuries which can cause heavy financial burden over the company they are working in. Proper posture and body mechanics provides an atmosphere for a healthy back, and reduces the chances for early degeneration of the spinal column.

5. Exercise and Training Pave the Way for Healthy Back

For maintaining a good posture you need to train the muscle of your back and abdominal region. Posture braces are actually used to train the muscles to act in a coordinated manner to achieve the good body posture. Posture bracing is helpful in enhancing the spinal column alignment to reduce the chances of irregular muscular tension which can lead towards posture imbalances.

There are various exercises are present which can be followed to improve the muscle tone and body posture. These exercises include the both groups, covering the back and abdominal region. Even with a healthy back, weakened abdominal muscles will put an accentuated amount of stress and strain on the back muscles.

Pelvic Floor Strength and Posture Exercises

Pelvic Floor Strength and Posture Exercises

Almost one third women population has pelvic-floor dysfunction of some kind or another like incontinence, pevic pain or pelvic organ prolapse etc.
Normally pelvic core muscles begin to deform around pregnancy.
Many pregnant women have low-back pain and diastasis recti (splitting of the abdominal muscles at the linea alba), which can lead to the lower abdominal protrusion or “pooch” that so many women develop after childbirth or significant weight loss.
The pelvic core muscles may also lose their reflexive capability to “turn on” automatically, and as a result they will be unable to support the entire core from the bottom up.
Now in such circumstance the best possible solution would be to go for three dimensional core training.

What Does Core Imply http://shop.intelliskin.net/posture-exercises-for-better-posture.html

Basically the core is an incorporated system that consists of many parts.
The “roof” is the respiratory diaphragm; the abdominals support the front wall; the back and hip muscles make up the back wall; and the pelvic-floor muscles make up the bottom.Together, these parts can be referred to as the Pelvic Core Neuromuscular System (PCNS).

The fascial system provides a network of functional feedback through the nervous system, linking the musculoskeletal system to the core.
This synergistic activity should happen without conscious effort.
If it does not, the PCNS must be trained. http://www.intelliskin.net/posture-exercises-for-better-posture.html
At this point, you had better understand the important fascial link of the pelvic floor muscles to the hip muscle through the arcuate tendon.
The pelvic floor muscles are fascially joined to the adductors which eventually gives a balanced and opposite reaction to the obtruator internus.
All these interconnections produce chain-reaction activation of the pelvic-floor muscles when hip rotation moves are added to a core-training exercise.

Habits for Fixing Your Posture

How to Improve Posture
Your habits impact every matter of your life. How you stand, sit, breathe and even think. The only factor behind your posture problems could be your own bad habits. But are you aware of their total influence on your actions? Try the following experiment.

1. Fold your arms and note the position of your hands and which arm is on the outside.

2. Now unfold them and fold them again but this time the opposite way.
Note your own feeling by doing this simple experiment.

Are you feeling uneasy and odd? Firstly you folded the arm in the way you naturally do it. You did it with no thinking as you are habitual to do it. But what happened at second time? You must have tried it after little thinking. It might be possible that you have taken lot of attempts to accomplish it. Actually you were not having an existing pattern for second one that is the reason it seemed awkward to you. It will probably feel wrong because you will not have done it like this before so the sensations from the muscles and joints will be new to you.

The important lesson from this experiment is how the two positions feel. The first position was habitual to you so you did not feel any problem in doing so but for the second you prepared your mind to take a different pose. It does not mean that there was something wrong but the reason is that you felt it in a different way. Would you feel same easiness in doing the second as you feel in first one. That is why what you feel right or wrong is determined by your habits actually. http://shop.intelliskin.net/how-to-improve-posture.html

So familiar feels right, unfamiliar feels wrong. Here was a moment in your life when you observe people to know how to fold arms instead of folding yourself. So you learnt this behavior by observing others. If you have never folded them the other way around you will never choose to do it this way and probably never cross your mind that it could be done another way. The way you folded it first time now has become a long term habit in your life.

So when you repeat the same position for folding the arms it makes you aware that it is right and makes proper pattern for such position. http://shop.intelliskin.net/how-to-improve-posture.html how to improve posture

Now what about how you stand, sit and walk, your basic actions that you spend every day performing? These actions also follow the same rule pattern which applies to your arm folding. You should have no doubt in it.

So how you sit at your desk is done in a way you have learnt to do it and it will feel right. It does not mean that this is the only way to sit but you never tried sitting in other way. If you did it then tell how did you feel? Can you maintain your new sitting position for long? Most of people feel uncomfortable for using new set of muscle for new pattern of sitting.

So all of us create our bubble to live in but can’t see outside it due to being enclosed. To the snowman inside his dome the weather never appears to change! How could you rectify the poor habits you have developed in a wrong way? Neck, back and shoulder pain are the most obvious symptoms but how can you accurately identify the cause when the fault lies with the very equipment you would use to diagnose and correct it? http://shop.intelliskin.net/posture-exercises-for-better-posture.html

Another thing which does not seem clear apparently is that poor postural habits never let you perform at your full potential.

So if you want to change posture you will need to leave following the way seems right to you. It’s true that you will feel uneasy to do so but remember that you are going to correct the wrong learning patterns. So here you need to experience the same feeling which felt during the opposite arm folding to bring a positive changing habit. This is the only way you can be sure you are not engaging your old, poor habits.

Habits to Fix and Control Posture

How to Improve Posture
Your habits impact every matter of your life. How you stand, sit, breathe and even think. The only factor behind your posture problems could be your own bad habits. But have you realized how it can influence your actions? Try the discussed experiment for this issues.

1. Fold your arms and note the position of your hands and which arm is on the outside.

2. Now unfold the arms to fold them again in an opposite manner.
Note your own feeling by doing this simple experiment.

Are you feeling uneasy and odd? Firstly you folded the arm in the way you naturally do it. You did it with no thinking as you are habitual to do it. But in second step you thought first and did after. It may even have taken several attempts to achieve. This is because you do not have an existing pattern for this movement and it has to be consciously worked out. It will possible to have an awkward feeling as such position is new to your muscles and joints framework.

The important lesson from this experiment is how the two positions feel. Your habitual pattern feels right and is easy to do, your non-habitual opposite way feels wrong and is not quite so easy to do. It does not imply that second position was wrong itself but your muscles and joints were not habitual to do so. Would you normally choose to fold your arms in this manner? So here your habits decide what is right for you and what seems wrong to you. http://shop.intelliskin.net/how-to-improve-posture.html

So familiar feels right, unfamiliar feels wrong. There was a time when you just watch others folding arms rather than doing it yourself.The important point is that you will have learnt to fold them in a particular way with either left or right arm on the outside. If you never tried to do it in opposite pattern then it means that you never thought about doing it in another way. The way you folded it first time now has become a long term habit in your life.

So when you repeat the same position for folding the arms it makes you aware that it is right and makes proper pattern for such position. http://shop.intelliskin.net/how-to-improve-posture.html how to improve posture

Now what about how you stand, sit and walk, your basic actions that you spend every day performing? The same pattern applies to these basic actions as well that apply to the learning of arm folding. Of course they are not.

So you sit at your desk according to the learning pattern of your sitting, which seems right to you. There are many ways to sit but would you ever try these out? If you do, how do they feel? Can you maintain your new sitting position for long? People can soon become uncomfortable as they use new muscles for sitting that are normally inactive for sitting.

So all of us create our bubble to live in but can’t see outside it due to being enclosed. It is just like as you are living in a dome and can’t feel and see the weather changes outside. If you develop poor habits relating to movement how would you know? Neck, back and shoulder pain are the most obvious symptoms but how can you accurately identify the cause when the fault lies with the very equipment you would use to diagnose and correct it? http://shop.intelliskin.net/posture-exercises-for-better-posture.html

Never performing to your full potential is a less obvious symptom simply because if you haven’t been there how do you know if you are underachieving?

So if you want to change posture you will need to leave following the way seems right to you. It’s true that you will feel uneasy to do so but remember that you are going to correct the wrong learning patterns. To successfully change a habit, any habit, you will have to go into the unknown – the feeling you had when folding your arms the opposite way. This is the only way you can be sure you are not engaging your old, poor habits.
